section.hand:
To my L. T
re
r Au
g
31 1591

addressleaf.section:
Belgia
1591 31 Au
g
To my L. Trea
s

page.lettertext:
It may please yo
r
good L. to be advertised that
e resolution
of
e
states
for the order of theyr traffique is sent to
M
r
Caron
, w
th
a l
re
to her
Ma
ty
.
w
ch
they caused this morning
to be signified unto mee. The forces of these countreys
continew still in garrison, & there is nothing yet concluded
about theyr employm
t
, Those of
Gueldres
&
Utrecht
wold have
th
e
returned to
e siege of
Nieumeg
e
,
the
states of Frisel
a
d
are earnest for
Stenewick,
Holland
for
Bolduke,
&
Zeland
for
Hulst.
w
ch
was
e enterprise intended, wh
e
e army was
dissolved, & hath depended every since, till certain captaines
shall returne, whom
e count hath employed to take a
view of
e countrey. It is thought the attempt of
Steenwick would prove overcostly, because the Town hath bin
fortefied since the shew that was made to besiege it this sommer
It hath besides in garrison 1200 souldyers, Ether Nieumeg
e
or Bolduc might be gott
e
more easily, if the Ennemies forces
were furder removed, & wee cannot yet surmise for what occasyon
they should linger so long in a place. We are newly now
advertised that they marche now to
Mastricht,
& that
e
Duke
is still at
Brussels.
Wheras yo
r
L. hath required me
of late to do some good for
M
r
Winter
, I have caused
Don
Alfonso
, &
Pedro Francesco
to write unto theyr friend
to
sollicit his deliverance: w
ch
they do, as they seem very willingly
& earnestly. For I have thus agreed w
th
th
e
both w
th
e
privity & liking of M
r
Winters
s
vant, That altho they be
men of greater account, in respect of theyr experience &
s
vice
in
e warres th
e
M
r
Winter, yet in
curing him to be p
nt
ly
released, they shall both bee set at liberty w
th
out payeng any ransom
For a far lesse somme, th
e
I
ceave M
r
Winter would disburse
to be Dl will content
e captaines of this contrey; for
e foresayd
prisoners. & I hold my self assured
t
Count Maurice in
that will take a favorable order. I am
e lesse out of hope
of good successe in this matter, because Alfonso I heare
is neere of kynne to
e D. of Parma, &
e oth
r
it is knowen
hath
s
ved
e Duke
es 22 yeares & did govern him greatly
in all his exploit
as no more about him. It is all my
feare w
ch
is also theyrs, as they signify unto mee, that
Mondragon
a spaniard & an ennemy to theyr nation will nether
make any rekoning of them, nor of any thing
e Duke shall
request in theyr behalf.
&c. Au
g
31 1591.
